# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `cvd_hard`
* Variable label: `History of stroke or myocardial infarction (heart attack)`
* Variable description: `The participant has been diagnosed by one or more of the following conditions: stroke or myocardial infarction or heart attack`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | no, the participant has not been diagnosed by stroke or myocardial infarction or heart attack
1        | yes, no, the participant has been diagnosed by stroke or myocardial infarction or heart attack

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "History of stroke or myocardial infarction (heart attack)"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
datafolder <- "../RData/"

```

# Data process



## Spain


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `mi_ha` |`stroke`|
|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `Myocardial infarction or heart attack`|`Stroke`|
| **Table name**  |`mi_ha`|`stroke`|
| **Categories** | `0 = No`<br/>`1 = Yes` |`0 = NOT A stroke (cerebral vascular disease)`<br/>`1 = A stroke (cerebral vascular disease)`|
| **Description** |  |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

load(paste0(datafolder,"w1/mi_ha.RData"))
ENRICA_w1 <- tibble(id=mi_ha$id)
ENRICA_w1$mi_ha <- mi_ha$mi_ha
rm(mi_ha)
load(paste0(datafolder,"w1/stroke.RData"))
ENRICA_w1$stroke <- stroke$stroke
rm(stroke)

```

```{r local w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ENRICA_w1$mi_ha
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ENRICA_w1)[3])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ENRICA_w1, aes(x=factor(mi_ha))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- ENRICA_w1$stroke
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ENRICA_w1)[4])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ENRICA_w1, aes(x=factor(stroke))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cvd_hard` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `all 0 into 0`
* `some 1 into 1`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ENRICA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ENRICA_w1$id)
ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard <- rep(999,length(ENRICA_w1$id))
ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard[which(ENRICA_w1$mi_ha==0 & ENRICA_w1$stroke==0)] <- 0
ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard[which(ENRICA_w1$mi_ha==1 | ENRICA_w1$stroke==1)] <- 1

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(ENRICA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(cvd_hard))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard)
X <- c(
  sum(ENRICA_w1$mi_ha==0 & ENRICA_w1$stroke==0,na.rm=T),
  sum(ENRICA_w1$mi_ha==1 | ENRICA_w1$stroke==1,na.rm=T)
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2])
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("all 0->0","some 1->1")
kable(C)

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**

```{r summ}
ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard <- labelled(ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard, labels = cat_label)
label(ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard) <- ds_label
ENRICA_ds_w2$cvd_hard <- labelled(ENRICA_ds_w2$cvd_hard, labels = cat_label)
label(ENRICA_ds_w2$cvd_hard) <- ds_label
ENRICA_ds_w3$cvd_hard <- labelled(ENRICA_ds_w3$cvd_hard, labels = cat_label)
label(ENRICA_ds_w3$cvd_hard) <- ds_label

ENRICA_m_ds_w1 <- ENRICA_ds_w1
ENRICA_m_ds_w1$cvd_hard <- car::recode(ENRICA_m_ds_w1$cvd_hard, "miss_values_vector=NA")
ENRICA_m_ds_w2 <- ENRICA_ds_w2
ENRICA_m_ds_w2$cvd_hard <- car::recode(ENRICA_m_ds_w2$cvd_hard, "miss_values_vector=NA")
ENRICA_m_ds_w3 <- ENRICA_ds_w3
ENRICA_m_ds_w3$cvd_hard <- car::recode(ENRICA_m_ds_w3$cvd_hard, "miss_values_vector=NA")


tt <-    frq(ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard)[[1]][,c(1:2,4)]
tt[4] <- frq(ENRICA_ds_w2$cvd_hard)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[5] <- frq(ENRICA_ds_w3$cvd_hard)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(ENRICA_ds_w1$cvd_hard), length(ENRICA_ds_w2$cvd_hard), length(ENRICA_ds_w3$cvd_hard)
             )
names(tt)<-c("val", "label", "w1", "w2", "w3")
kable(tt)

dbb <- merge(ENRICA_m_ds_w1[,c("id","cvd_hard")], ENRICA_m_ds_w2[,c("id","cvd_hard")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w1",".w2"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, ENRICA_m_ds_w3[,c("id","cvd_hard")], by="id", all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w1", "w2", "w3")
v.dbb <- paste(dbb[,2],dbb[,3],dbb[,4],sep="")
f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,])
```
